briefing.opening: Good morning/afternoon. We will now begin the climate briefing for 2025-12-21.

sections.title: ğŸ‡°ğŸ‡· Accelerating Domestic Carbon Neutrality Goal Implementation and Industrial Transition
sections.content: Domestically, various efforts are underway to achieve carbon neutrality goals. HL Mando officially received SBTi approval for its '63% greenhouse gas reduction by 2035' target [3]. With 40% of automotive parts companies recognizing the necessity of carbon neutrality, Hyundai Motor and Kia are collaborating with public and private sectors to support supply chain transitions [7, 11]. In local communities, Gyeongbuk Province received the highest rating in the carbon-neutral lifestyle practice evaluation [8], and several local governments, including Jinju City, Seosan City, and Nowon-gu, are leading the creation of eco-friendly cities through events like the 2050 Carbon Neutrality Forum and regular committee meetings [9, 12, 13]. aT also received the 'Consumer ESG Innovation Award' for its climate change response efforts, emphasizing the responsible role of corporations [1].

sections.title: ğŸŒ± Breakthrough Progress and Policy Drive in Renewable Energy Transition
sections.content: Encouraging news has emerged in the energy transition sector. This year, renewable energy surpassed fossil fuel energy for the first time, earning a spot on Science magazine's 'Breakthrough of the Year' list [14]. Domestically, in line with this trend, the ruling party and government have announced the swift processing of the Special Act on Renewable Energy Self-Sufficient Cities and the commencement of RE100 industrial complex development, accelerating the energy transition [17, 21]. The Ministry of Climate is simultaneously pursuing sluice gate expansion and tidal power generation in Saemangeum, aiming for both water quality improvement and renewable energy expansion [16]. The Daegu Regional Environmental Office is also actively accelerating the renewable energy transition in the Daegu and Gyeongbuk regions, demonstrating robust efforts at the local government level [18]. In Gochang County, a policy forum was held for the creation of a new and renewable energy complex [15], and calls for energy transition through the installation of solar panels in public parking lots have also been raised, indicating comprehensive transition movements [20].

sections.title: âš ï¸ Realization of the Climate Crisis and Domestic and International Policy Challenges
sections.content: As the climate crisis becomes a reality, accelerating the transition of industrial and energy structures is becoming even more urgent [2]. However, domestically, there are criticisms that vehicle idling persists within the National Assembly, rendering carbon neutrality goals meaningless [6]. Furthermore, questions have been raised regarding the exclusion of nuclear power from the Ministry of Climate's work report, with some asking if it signifies an abandonment of carbon neutrality [10]. Internationally, there have been calls for data centers to make greater efforts to combat climate change [29], and reports that liberals are increasingly backing away from apocalyptic predictions about climate change, illustrating the complexity of the climate response discourse [27].

sections.title: ğŸŒ International Impacts, Adaptation, and Awareness-Raising Efforts Regarding Climate Change
sections.content: Climate change is impacting the world in various ways, with scientific possibilities even suggesting that global warming could trigger the next ice age [26]. Concerns are rising that national park travel is becoming unpredictable [24] and that everyday elements like Rudolph and White Christmas will be affected [23], while Pakistan is also experiencing climate change [28, 30]. Amidst these circumstances, international policy efforts continue, such as Abu Dhabi's carbon-neutral city experiment [4, 5] and GCF's support for strengthening Thailand's climate adaptation capacity [31]. Awareness-raising efforts are also active, including travelers' climate change offsetting actions [25] and a climate folk song from Maine, USA [22]. Notably, Kenya's Women in Climate Change Organization (WICCO) is promoting environmental conservation and food security through tree planting and vegetable garden cultivation education [32, 33], and in the Venice Lagoon area, research on halophytes is underway to address soil salinization issues caused by rising sea levels [34], demonstrating active community-level adaptation strategies.

briefing.closing: Today's briefing highlighted the progress in domestic and international carbon neutrality efforts and the positive trend in renewable energy transition. However, it also underscored the need for continued attention and effort regarding policy challenges and international impacts in responding to the climate crisis. This concludes today's climate briefing.

articles.title: The plants that thrive in salt: could halophytes help save coastal farming?

summary.phenomenon: In the Venice Lagoon area, soil salinization is occurring due to rising sea levels, leading scientists and chefs to focus on halophytes (e.g., samphire), plants resistant to salinity.
summary.cause: Soil salinization in the Venice Lagoon area is occurring due to rising sea levels.
summary.outlook: Halophyte plants are expected to help save salinized coastal agriculture.
